comment:
Variables:
- \( x \): number of loaves of bread to bake
- \( y \): number of batches of cookies to bake

Constants:
- \( M = 3000 \): maximum number of hours each machine can run per year
- \( P_{\text{bread}} = 5 \): profit per loaf of bread
- \( P_{\text{cookies}} = 3 \): profit per batch of cookies
- \( T_{\text{bread}} = 1 \): time in hours to bake a loaf of bread in the stand mixer
- \( T_{\text{oven\_bread}} = 3 \): time in hours to bake a loaf of bread in the oven
- \( T_{\text{cookies}} = 0.5 \): time in hours to bake a batch of cookies in the stand mixer
- \( T_{\text{oven\_cookies}} = 1 \): time in hours to bake a batch of cookies in the oven

Objective:
Maximize total profit:
\[ \text{Maximize } Z = P_{\text{bread}} \cdot x + P_{\text{cookies}} \cdot y \]

Constraints:
- Time constraint for stand mixer: \( T_{\text{bread}} \cdot x + T_{\text{cookies}} \cdot y \leq M \)
- Time constraint for oven: \( T_{\text{oven\_bread}} \cdot x + T_{\text{oven\_cookies}} \cdot y \leq M \)
- Non-negativity constraint: \( x, y \geq 0 \)
